param.name: G
param.dialogReference:
FS values

Grid, output

Resulting factor-of-safety (-) grid

param.name: H
param.dialogReference:
FS classes

Grid, output, optional

optional

Resulting stability (0/1) grid

tool.summary: This tool computes a slope stability (expressed as a factor-of-safety) raster according to the traditional infinite slope model theory (see cf Selby, 1993) The resulting raster represents the ratio of resisting forces/driving forces (fs) on a potential shear plane with fs lesser 1 unstable, fs greater 1 stable. Except for a slope raster (in radians), all input variables can be specified either globally or distributed (through grids). The tool creates a continuous fs raster (values above 10 are truncated), and a binary stability grid with nodata = stable, 1 = unstable (optional).

dataIdInfo.idCredit: Conrad, O., Bechtel, B., Bock, M., Dietrich, H., Fischer, E., Gerlitz, L., Wehberg, J., Wichmann, V., and Boehner, J. (2015): System for Automated Geoscientific Analyses (SAGA) v. 2.1.4, Geosci. Model Dev., 8, 1991-2007, doi:10.5194/gmd-8-1991-2015. [SAGA - System for Automated Geoscientific Analyses - saga-gis.org]
